page.title: 06Saxonbury Farm,East Sussex
page.content: Saxonbury Farm is a red-brick farm near Mark-Cross.The farm used to be bigger,but when the farmer's father retired,he sold some of the farm which is now Colesgrove Farm. Saxonbury Farm has always been a sheep farm and the present farmer has farmed it for 34 years.He has 200 Kent ewes and 5 Dorset Down rams.In 1985 he had 300 lambs and they were born in April-early May.He has one sheep-dog called Meg and 15 fields.When the lambs are 40kg they go to Lamberhurst or Heathfield markets.When the lambs are slaughtered nothing is wasted.The skins go to a craftsman who makes rugs,coats,gloves etc,and the bones are made into fertilizer or vitamin E and the feet are made into glue.
